title: Using derivatives to recognize graph of function

content.question: If y is a function of x such that y' > 0 for all x and y'' < 0 for all x, which of the following could be part of the graph of y = fÂ (x)?

choices.label: A positively-sloped curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point on the negative x axis in the second quadrant and rising upward to enter the first quadrant cutting the positive y axis.

A curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point in the third quadrant, and rises upward cutting the positive x axis after passing through the second quadrant. It eventually enters the first quadrant.

A curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point in the second quadrant, and slopes downward entering the first quadrant after cutting the positive y axis and then entering the fourth quadrant after cutting the positive x axis.
A curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point in the third quadrant, rises upward and enters the fourth quadrant  cutting the negative y axis.
A curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point close to the negative x axis in the second quadrant, rises upward and then enters the first quadrant cutting the positive y axis.

content.answer: A curve is plotted on the xy plane. The curve starts from a point in the third quadrant, and rises upward cutting the positive x axis after passing through the second quadrant. It eventually enters the first quadrant.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
